attributes.additional_details: A British marine has been found 'guilty' of 'murdering' an injured Taliban enemy soldier and is facing LIFE in a prison cell, after seeing many of his comrades dismembered and hung from trees I think that he alowed the enemy soldier a dignified death as opposed to what may of happened should the shoe have been on the other foot.  I would also like to know how many Taliban soldiers have been charged with murdering British soldiers. This man is a war Hero and deserves recogintion for putting his life in danger along with every serving British and foreign soldier protecting our values.
